page.title: 04EDUCATION
page.content: Alness has three primary schools and one secondary school. Bridgend Primary: was built in 1963 for children living around the centre of the town. Its current roll is 330. This is a decrease in numbers compared to recent years. Obsdale Primary: was built in 1974 and caters for children from the East end of town.Its current roll is 160 and here we also see a decrease in numbers. Coulhill Primary: was built in 1974 and its catchment area is mainly from the West end of town.Its roll is 415 and is also a decrease. Alness Academy: this is a six-year comprehensive school which opened in temporary accommodation in 1975.The permanent building was opened in 1977. Its roll has now grown to 841.
